content.description:
Start on bad slopers, move up right to a good edge around the corner, then dyno to the lip. From here, traverse 15 feet up and left to the top.

Eds. this route has been orphaned is up for adoption.
content.location: On northeastern corner, obvious when you get there.

content.description:
On the direct north face, start low in the cave/overhang on very bad slopers. Pull up, pop to sharp but good edge, match, then work to the lip.

Eds. this route has been orphaned is up for adoption.
content.location: On the direct north face of the Whale Boulder. Obvious when you get there.

content.description: Start matching on a good sloping edge (shorter folks may jump) where the overhang steepens to a face. Use a combination of the arete and faceholds to reach easier ground to top out.
content.location: The route may not have chalk on it, but the rain-protected sit-start (Barrel of Monkeys, V13) should. Look for an obvious overhang with a good starting edge where the boulder turns more vertical. The chalked up sit start at the start of the overhang is Barrel of Monkeys.

content.description:
One of the world’s better boulder problems and an amazing Front Range testpiece, Barrel Rider is a singular line out the overhang of the huge Blue Whale/South Paw Boulder.

Begin sitting on the lowest opposing edges at the bottom of the large overhang. Climb out the roof and left to a good slot, then execute a big, hard, and low percentage jump/deadpoint to a bullet sloper. Traverse across the lip on perfect slopers with minimal feet to finish on the classic

Blue Whale

(V7/8), making for a long, power endurance based finish.

The rock on this climb is perfect. The moves are phenomenal and fun. The style is skin friendly and thuggy. The landing is flat. This boulder is perfect.
content.protection: A good number of pads. The landing is good, but the climb covers some ground.
content.location: It is on the Blue Whale Boulder off the Eldorado Canyon Trail. Begin sitting on the left side of the boulder’s massive overhang. Climb left then right out the obvious feature.

content.description:
The arete on the northwestern corner. Start low on a good right hand, punch left to a bad pinch/squeeze, move up and then hit the lip.

Eds. this route has been orphaned is up for adoption.
content.location: On the northwestern corner, obvious when you get there.
